sentences.english: Where heaves the turf in many a mouldering heap.
sentences.chinese: 龟裂的草皮一丘丘隆起。

sentences.english: All the athletes have to train on is a small patch of Astroturf;
sentences.chinese: 所有的运动员在一块人工草皮上训练。

sentences.english: That's a stretch of turf four times the size of New York City.
sentences.chinese: 这相当于纽约市四倍的草皮面积。

sentences.english: The house is called a sod house or soddy .
sentences.chinese: 那么房子就叫做草皮屋或草屋。

sentences.english: She bought some turfs to repair her lawn.
sentences.chinese: 她买一些草皮修补她的草坪。

sentences.english: The grass was sown in the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 草皮已植在了体育场里。

sentences.english: One long column, half-burned, had fallen across the lawn, crushing the cape jessamine bushes.
sentences.chinese: 有根圆柱还烧剩一半，横倒在草皮上，把茉莉花丛。

sentences.english: The greensward all wracked is, bents dried up and dead.
sentences.chinese: 草皮干瘪枯萎弯曲死掉。

sentences.english: The asphalt playgrounds have been grassed over or sown with flowers.
sentences.chinese: 原来的柏油操场已经复上了草皮或种满了鲜花。

sentences.english: They strode over the springy turf.
sentences.chinese: 他们大步走在松软的草皮上。

sentences.english: The wall surface of the explosion dike body is covered with a planting soil stuffing bag or a sod.
sentences.chinese: 所述防爆堤体的墙面包裹有种植土填料包或草皮。

sentences.english: If you plant the seeds outside when the weather is cool, place the seeds on the regrass , that under a glass.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在寒冷的湖外种植，要把种子放在草皮底下。

sentences.english: But why cover your car in sod?
sentences.chinese: 不过为什么要盖上一层草皮呢？

sentences.english: He is able to identify that specific spot by reference to the divot hole which his previous stroke made.
sentences.chinese: 根据前一杆打时削起的草皮，他能判定具体的位置。

sentences.english: NO13, Put the grass cuttings on the compost heap.
sentences.chinese: 把切割好的草皮放在施好肥料的土上。

sentences.english: To thy high requiem become a sod.
sentences.chinese: 如一块草皮对你的安魂曲。

definition: sandy beach or river bank/sand dune/sandy land
Huatan township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
decorative mass planting of flowers and shrubs, often bounded by a low masonry border, and often part of a streetscape
crushed or broken rock, stone etc
